Thank you for your note and for your continued interest in School_D.

To answer your question directly: yes—there is a scenario in which we would reconsider, but it depends on whether higher-priority candidates for School_D remain active in the market and likely to pursue us. At this stage, we are still keeping our single seat available in case one of those candidates applies.

If you would like, you can share any updated information about your status in the process (e.g., which schools you are still actively pursuing and whether you have any pending offers). That context can help us understand how likely it is that you would remain available in later rounds.

We appreciate your patience and continued engagement.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for the clear update—this is helpful.

In general terms, we will begin considering candidates beyond our higher-priority group only once it becomes sufficiently unlikely that those higher-priority students will apply to School_D. Because the process is dynamic, we can’t guarantee a specific round when that will be certain.

Practically, our approach is:
- We will keep our single seat available while there remains a realistic chance that one of our higher-priority students may apply.
- If, over the next several rounds, we continue to receive no applications from those higher-priority students (and/or we have reason to believe they have committed elsewhere), we will reassess and may be able to move to the next candidates on our list.

Given that you are currently unmatched and would accept immediately, please feel free to check in again in a later round if your status remains the same. If anything changes on your end (e.g., you begin pursuing another school or receive an offer), please let us know as well.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
